attributes.action: Single parents with toddlers should have a time to shop at supermarkets
attributes.additional_details:
Multiple times I have gone to the supermarket to get my baby essentials for example 'wipes and nappies' and there have been none whatsoever on the shelf leaving me and some other unhappy parents stressed having to go to local corner shops which are very expensive and not ideal for single parents with a low income. 
There is also no paracetamol or baby milk which is worrying.
attributes.background:
Supermarkets have allocated time slots for the elderly people/vulnerable and NHS staff which is an amazing gesture
It would really help if there was one for single parents with children under the age of 3

rejection.details:
The opening arrangements for supermarkets are a matter for individual retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

You may wish to sign one or both of these petitions about limiting purchases and issuing ration books for essentials including baby items:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302823

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
